website_summaries.verdict: The Eton Grundig G2 Reporter is more than just a little portable radio, but it has some drawbacks to consider before you buy.
pros: The Eton Grundig G2 Reporter is a small, slim, and lightweight AM/FM/SW radio with 4GB of internal storage and a microSD slot for recording as well as playback of MP3/WMA files and a line-in jack for connecting an external source
cons: The G2 Reporter runs on a rechargeable battery that charges by USB only (wall adapter not included)
its e-book function is a joke
and operating it can be confusing

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio
customer_reviews.text: I am a radio fancier as I have collected more than 50 radios in the past ten years. This one is a new comer as it can make record the programs which is broadcasting while I am working in my office. I will never miss an important program with this radio. It's small, compact and great in sound. But it's SW is not as clear as my other collections such as Tecsun 9700 or 9702 or Sangen, or anther Grundig Potable radio. Neverthless, I still love this great radio. It's only drawback is that the recording you do with this radio is not MP3 format.
customer_reviews.author: wenghuizhang

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this radio a lot more but it has one big problem. When listening to mp3's, it will be working fine and then it will start to drop out portions of the mp3. The radio has good reception but the tone has no base at all. The mp3 player has an equalizer setting but there is nothing that affects the radio. Also, the Amazon listing did not mention that it was refurbished but there was a sticker on the box stating it was.
customer_reviews.author: Hatburger

customer_reviews.title: Works Great..have not tried all features.
customer_reviews.text: Everything works well. Tuner is excellent on FM and RDS works, but tries to categorize the station so it ends up with a smaller display. I got an extra battery here for about $5 and a separate charger for about the same. It seems that sleep mode drains the battery. I have to check this again. It runs a good 10 hours on a charge using RDS and at moderate volume. I stick it back in the case sometimes or throw a towel over it to give the sound more depth. Very easy to use for a Grundig guy.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Not user friendly. Difficult to operate. An expensive paperweight. Short battery life. I thought it would be more sensitive. I have less expensive radios which are able to pick up moderately distant AM stations more clearly without a lot of background hiss and crackle. (poor signal to noise ratio) The tuning knob fell off, but luckily I was able to find it and secure it with a small drop of plastic cement. The record feature produces noisy hissy low quality mp3s. FM reception works well, but I like to listen to AM talk shows. Not my favorite radio. Would I recommend it? No.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Impressive radio with mp3 and wav recording.
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice radio. I am able to receive a low power FM station that I cannot copy with any other radio at home. The only negative remark is that if I start recording a low signal station, the recording process creates a noise which is included in the recording. This radio surpassed my expectations. The seller shipped promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Calero

customer_reviews.title: Grundig G2 AM/FM/Shortwave Radio, Recorder - Black (NG2B)
customer_reviews.text: The radio part is good to excellent, AM FM SW and MP3 work well but... the only knob on it just falls off with the slightest excuse and soon will be lost. The type font on all the buttons is too small and the saddest that chose red lettering on black insured that the radio can only be used in perfect lighting conditions. I do notice that picking the free supersaver shipping lets the seller wait 3 to 4 days before shipping the radio. An $80 radio should include a buck wall wart for charging and operation made more insulting by the non standard recharagable LiON special battery.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Keating

customer_reviews.title: Good portable radio and music player
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this radio/MP3 player. It's pretty good as both a radio and an MP3 player, as long as you understand the limitations associated with the size of the unit and don't expect much bass from the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: i would advise any purchaser to not get burned buying electronic items without thoroughly checking that everything works ok. I made the mistake of buying this item as a gift to my wife.She did not check it.out promptly. the unit only works on AM, The unit are discontiued. Only buy electronics from reputable dealers, Highly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rahsaan Abdullah

customer_reviews.title: Good radio
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reception and function. Internal battery life does not compare well against similar size radios using AA batteries. Very sensitive FM. picks up distant stations very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio has really performed as reviewed by others I would like to recommend to those who like recording music or Talks
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Tapetillo

customer_reviews.title: likely my sort of ugly older TECSUN PL-380 multi-band a superior device.
customer_reviews.text: Eccentric to use, especially plus & minus station change buttons. Confess have not really tried to use shortwave features... Overall, likely my sort of ugly older TECSUN PL-380 multi-band a superior device...
customer_reviews.author: hal kirk

customer_reviews.title: It’s a nice radio but the speakers on my phone sound louder ...
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice radio but the speakers on my phone sound louder and better.... I would not recommend it, too expensive for the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Radio
customer_reviews.text: After I received the radio, I was going to send it back. But after using it and figuring how to use it I was delighted. It's compact and has a great sound for it's size.
customer_reviews.author: George Weaver Ranger188

customer_reviews.title: Dead battery
customer_reviews.text: The radio it self is great.. But the battery that was sent to me did not work and I went and had it tested and the battery is garbage.. So little disapointEd
customer_reviews.author: Carly polsom

customer_reviews.title: Good basic compact AM, FM, SW radio
customer_reviews.text: Good little radio. Does all the things I wanted. Satisfies my basic AM, FM, and SW radio needs, and it is really compact.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Claybaugh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Haven't used it much. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Paula D. Behrens

customer_reviews.title: Reception is great. Sound is okey
customer_reviews.text: I am impress with this product. Reception is great. Sound is okey, not great, but aceptable
customer_reviews.author: Byron

customer_reviews.title: Utter Failed Gadget
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat complicated to operate......then absolutely FROZEN. The high failure rate is apparently known, but not mentioned in most catalog ads.
customer_reviews.author: L. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this radio based on past favorable experience with Grundig products. I was very disappointed. The radio itself has a very 'plastic' feel to it. Reception of all bands was very very poor and this model does not have an input for an outside antenna..so you are stuck with the reception you get..no way really to improve--although I did try the alligator clip trick but that became cumbersome and really didn't help much. If you live in an area with heavy RF you will be very frustrated. I ended up returning the Grundig and purchased the Sangean 909X...granted a little more money but well worth it!!,
customer_reviews.author: kdoyledoo@aol.com

customer_reviews.title: Worst thing I've every seen
customer_reviews.text: Worst thing I've every seen. Sold it on eBay and felt guilty. Should be in the trash. If you like Grundig the g8 is good.
customer_reviews.author: Qpounderwidchz

customer_reviews.title: Handy During Sandy..
customer_reviews.text: This excellent and useful radio turned out to really help us recently in the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy. When Sandy struck, our are lost power for a few days, and this aided us in staying in touch with news, and updates. The device is relatively easy to setup, and somewhat easy to figure out. You just have to tinker for a little while (or even read the directions!) to learn to operate the radio satisfactorily. The sound is adequate for its' purpose - although it sounds somewhat 'tinny'. The addition of the SD slot is a useful feature for playing various content you already own.
customer_reviews.author: Bromptonboy

customer_reviews.title: Expected More
customer_reviews.text: This is a computerized shortwave am/fm radio. The reception of the am/fm is very nice but the shortwave is hampered by the lack of an external antenna. It is nicely made and finished. Considering what is available in sound quality in current small speakers technology - this clearly disappoints. The packaging and presentation is beautiful. There is also a proprietary battery - I would have expected AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Zeb

customer_reviews.title: This radio is an excellent product and provides am fm and sw band coverage
customer_reviews.text: This radio is an excellent product and provides am fm and sw band coverage.The real value however is its ability to play MP3 on sd cards.I have 3900 old time radio shows on a 32g sd card that plays randomly on this radio.Buy it and you will have a great portable entertainment device.
customer_reviews.author: fordham

customer_reviews.title: Thin & Compact
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased my brand new Degen version of the Grundig from Anon in China for less than $50! Great little radio! Thin, compact, great sound for a little package.
customer_reviews.author: RJLinNEO

customer_reviews.title: A WASTE OF TIME AND $
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing purchase. Grundig should be ashamed to put their name on this product , let alone make it . It's cheap! and a ripoff The battery life is terrible. The rechargeable battery is dead after 3 months. The sound is mediocre and the various band wave receptions are disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: allison fields

customer_reviews.title: fantastic features but fantastic failure
customer_reviews.text: I too wanted so badly for this radio recorder to actually work. The only other radio like it (C. Crane)was way too expensive. Bought this on Black Friday .. found it for 47. at Frys. Got it home and the first button I pushed hung up and stuck. I figured it really was too good to be true so with out further ado I repacked it and took it back. I wonder now if the smart phone era has ruined the markets for other smart devices such as this.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Kimes

product_meta.title: Eton Grundig G2 AM / FM / Shortwave Radio, Recorder - Black, NG2B
product_meta.description: The Grundig Reporter is a portable travel radio that features multi-language capabilities and five tuning methods, providing a convenient way to listen to your favorite content wherever you go, from anywhere in the world. The Reporter is another reliable radio and information source added to the Grundig series. Use the five tuning methods - jog, manual, auto, memory, or ATS (Auto Tuning Storage) - to quickly scan or browse stations from anywhere in the world - hearing broadcasts in each country’s native language. The Reporter furthers its international appeal with multiple language capability, allowing users to choose from a variety of languages to be shown on the LCD display.
feature_bullets: Digital AM/FM/SW radio with signal strength indicator
5 tuning methods: jog tuning, manual, auto tuning, ATS (Auto Tuning Storage)
MP3 and WMA decode and recording, E-Book TXT support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars88 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
